website_summaries.verdict: If you use your PC primarily for gaming, watching movies, or for enjoying your favorite music, it’s hard to beat the superior sound that Razer’s impressive full range speakers pumps out.
pros: Pair of powerful and clear computer speakers for a premium gaming experience
Customizable lighting with millions of colors
cons: The Nommo Chroma sounds amazing and puts on a stellar light show, but it’s a pricy pair of speakers

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound quality, I used to have Bose 2.1 speakers, but this one beats Bose for sure.
customer_reviews.text: You can switch Bluetooth mode, optical mode or USB PC mode any time on your phone APP. The color of the speaker is fantastic. And you can setting your game color for the specific game.
customer_reviews.author: Yi Xuan

customer_reviews.title: These speakers are amazing. The only thing that threw us off a ...
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are amazing. The only thing that threw us off a little that they are bigger than we had expected, which is not a bad thing. I love the light that they have on the bottom, since we have a mouse and controller that light up the same way, it makes it look complete. The sound quality is great and they're easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Nice speakers but no bass
customer_reviews.text: These are nice looking speakers with all those lights that gamers apparently demand. Sadly though, these speakers only sound so-so and lack any bass since there's no subwoofer. For the money you spend on these Razer speakers, you can some amazing sounding speakers with a sub from Logitech that actually sound better. I bought them because they lacked a sub as I don't need to annoy my neighbors any more than I already do, so I like the fact they don't come with a sub. One caveat of these speakers is that they are controlled by Razer's awful Synapse software which likes to forget my username and password requiring me to remember my login info every few weeks. ANNOYING ++.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a month of using
customer_reviews.text: Extraordinarily disappointed with quality of product and deceptive sales practice by either Amazon or the third party seller. Ordered this "New" through Amazon on June 5th and it stopped powering on today - July 15th (1 day past the warranty). When calling Razer support, they said that the warranty had expired November 9th of LAST YEAR and they would "investigate whether a claim could be fulfilled". This is also on the seller, who represented themselves as an authorized reseller of a New product, which this most certainly was not. Very frustrated, because the product was excellent when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Razer broke Chroma Sync with an Update
customer_reviews.text: I would not get this garbage. First of all sound quality isnt up there with the price. Im not an audiophile tho so its fine for me. Now what really sucks is how since April 2020 razer pushed a Synapse update that broke chroma connects module and now these speakers are the one thing that dont sync with the rest of my peripherals. Instead the chroma lags and switches to a random color every couple of seconds. Ive been contacting razer since april, sending logs and more logs and they still dont know what the hell they broke. Might as well get any speaker without chroma since its now broken.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality you would think
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and lets just say I am completely disappointed in these the higher pitch sounds crisp and clear but the so called bass is a joke my $30 Logitech speakers has more bass then these if your looking for something with bass get one with an actual sub-woofer with it. I wont be buying anything from razer again. For those that say this has lots of bass or they have to turn it down to half doesn't know what real bass sounds like
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, very loud. The rgb is a joke though.
customer_reviews.text: I love them! The sound quality is great very loud and clear with good bass. I am very happy with the sound aspect of these speakers, but the reason I spent 50$ more on these versus the regular non chroma edition was the RGB lighting. It is so dim, even turned to 100% brightness. The RGB lighting is so unnoticable compared to everything else it might as well not be there, save yourself 50$ and get the regular non chroma version.
customer_reviews.author: Aeroreviews

customer_reviews.title: These things are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t care about the chroma, regular version is 33% cheaper and are litteraly the same thing without lights, but for me, I really wanted the lights. The only feature exclusive to this version is the chroma and USB connection to your computer. They’re loud, sound amazing, have really good base, and just make your setup look dope as hell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great THX sound but short cables
customer_reviews.text: in THX mode these speckers get loud and sound great. In Dolby mode with my onboard sound card on ASUS ROG formula XI I get high pitch squeaks in the background. This is a known issue with many Realtek sound cards. Also you need to prepare yourself with how large the sub is, it is massive! but it gives amazing bass that sounds great. I knock off one star on the review for the short cables. The speaker cables are only about 6 feet long, what a issue for putting your speakers just where you want them. These speakers are also a special 10 pin connector and after days of looking I can not find a cable extension anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Zigma

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy them.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not necessarily an audio snob, but these sound great and work great. One slight annoyance is the cable is not that long (it's like 6 feet I think) so if you're running it from edge to edge of three monitors, chances are it's not long enough. I'm currently in that situation as I just added a third, but looked and found  to see if that'll work for extending the cable length. Might look at grabbing a 90 degree connector if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great sound system, without a base!
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound system, i can't ever complain about razor product ( always have had good luck with them ). Warning - The speakers were a little bigger than expected. Made it work though as the sound quality was pretty good. ( Doesn't beat my other set - Bose 2.1 )
customer_reviews.author: Kades

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure what to expect from these speakers, but I was pleasantly surprised with the sound quality. Bass is adjustable with the turn of a knob and doesn’t drown vocals or high notes when turned all the way up. The speakers have an attractive, modern design that will complement either a gaming environment or personal multimedia space. I’d definitely recommend these speakers. Just my opinion, but sound quality is similar if not better than Bose Companion 2 Series III.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these speakers. Even though I like Razer products, I purchased this item with a grain of salt as I'm very sensitive to audio quality. After all, I'm happy to call them my own. I had a thx certified set of 5.1 Klipsch and Logitech speakers and the Razer blow them away!!! The fact you only have three speakers to set up vs. 6 is huge and experiencing these three speakers sound so much better is golden. I really recommend them despite the big pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: S. Froese

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Sound for $100
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I received a defected product, or if all Razer Nommo sound like this. When I listen to the sound coming from these speakers it sounds like I am in the bathroom. Everything sounds muffled, the sound is not clear and crisp. I will return these and try one more. If the second is the same I will go with Bose, or something with better sound quality. The replacement Razer Nommo sound the same. I fell for all the good reviews, should have listened to the 1 stars. I will be returning these. Razer did make a unique looking pair of speakers I'll give them that. It's a shame these speakers lacked clear crisp sound.
customer_reviews.author: davidorviet

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers they are outstanding. Great build and sound quality packaged with care razer app controls color very cool. Worth every dime and easy to set up. I went with the RGB for 25 bucks more was worth it to me. Arrived on time thanks Amazon excellent as usual even during this hard time. The people complaining about sound quality probably received defective speakers. The packaging was excellent despite what a few have said. You have to keep in mind Razer isn't at fault if the fed ex guy punts the box.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great, but bass is underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I got this during a black friday sale and for what I paid I believe it was worth it. The speakers can get pretty loud, they look really cool. but the bass doesn't really punch like I expected. I was trying to replace an old Logitech speaker system with dedicated subwoofer so that I could get rid of the sub under my desk. It was a cheap $30 system so I figured these could match it. Unfortunately it couldn't match the dedicated subwoofer which I guess was to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Maroun

customer_reviews.title: Long story short
customer_reviews.text: Honestly if your looking into buying desktop speakers, and you want quality ones at that. I would stop looking. The sound quality is amazing for $100, and the bass is enough to satesfy. I do agree that the rgb version is overpriced. But these are honestly amazing. The disign gets it off your desk, and that's a big deal for people like me who don't have the biggest desks in the world and really appreciate the extra space it gives. Unless your looking at a pending 300+ on speakers these are the best your going to find
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Great Overall Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I attach these to my gaming laptop when I’m not using headphones and they fill up my whole room at 30+% volume. These are not surround speakers and they act pretty normal when gaming but the sound quality when playing music and movies are way better than my previous computer speakers. There is absolutely no distortion as I raise the volume since the bass knob adjusts the equalizer with automatic gain a o I don’t have to mess with any settings or do any tuning.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Luu

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but they are 2.5" drivers.
customer_reviews.text: I feel misled by Razer. These sounded ok, but nothing like my older speakers that also had 3" drivers. Base sounded meh, and capped off pretty early. So, I was curious. Turns out these drivers are NOT 3", but 2.5". That's not a small difference on speakers of this size. Leave it to Razer to fake numbers... I'm letting them break in for a few more days, but they are probably going back for the price. Definitely dishonest business practices.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: I love these at $100 (no chroma)
customer_reviews.text: These are really, really good speakers at this price. Obviously, I bought them for the gaming look, but the sound quality is very good. On a song with full hd audio and surround sound, these speakers really shine. I'm not a technical audiophile, so I don't know exactly what technical details makes them work best, but I have heard songs on these speakers that give a spatial experience. They can rock the house for sure. I usually let the volume sit just below 50 and the bass jsut above. But I'll turn the dial up from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound but a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm happy with the purchase but, I don't feel they have as good of a frequency response as what I was expecting for the amount of money I paid. I feel I paid more for the brand name than for the actual speaker performance. The speakers are a lot larger than I thought they were going to be and the led's on the bottom of the bases... well..... I guess it's cool... but it really doesn't do that much for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: Like em but not crazy about these speakers
customer_reviews.text: None of the follow was a surprise post purchase, upfront the research was done. My Razer Nommo Chroma are dedicated computer speakers used primarily for gaming. They get the job done. But nothing about them is spectacular. The obvious warts are no Bluetooth, short cables, and just OK sound. Pluses are their small size, built in volume and bass control knobs, minimalist RGB lighting and sturdy design.
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: Dont believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: I have to disagree with the positive reviews. First off there should not 2 Verizon of these, if your buying a razer product most people are going to want the chroma, it makes a gaming branded product that much more enjoyable. Secondly it's over priced for what you get, and should have come with a subwoofer output for an optional sub, the base is anemic when compared to similar 2.1 systems in the same price range and size footprint.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you would expect a Razer product to be. Very expensive but looks great and works great. They are a perfect addition to any setup and sound good. Being honest, they are loud but not loud enough. They can fill up a room with loud noise but they dont get loud enough for a party or anything. I would recommend them for a nice way to spice up your setup.
customer_reviews.author: Poizoni

customer_reviews.title: Defective on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for the RGB aesthetics to match with my PC setup. I plugged in the speakers and the speakers wouldn't stay on. every time I turned the speakers on it would slowly start decreasing in volume and eventually turn off completely. The lighting effects also didn't change to any colors or effects other than the green breathing effect. I tried different USB ports as well as reinstalling Razer Synapse and the problems still persisted after 4 hours of troubleshooting. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Allen B

customer_reviews.title: Wait Nommo
customer_reviews.text: I will always err to side of caution and purchase from audio manufacturers when we are talking optimal sound quality. While I'm no audiophile, I think this product does what it was made to do, satisfy the gamers (and razer fanboys/girls) out there and enthrall the consumer with the RGB goodness, while producing pretty decent sound. For $129, hell yes it's worth it. Buy it now.
customer_reviews.author: Aila

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two of them, sent them both back
customer_reviews.text: When the sound came through, they sounded great, HOWEVER the USB connection would NOT remain connected to the PC. And since the only other connection is optical, it made these speakers a giant paperweight. Also, the satellite speakers are HUGE - especially compared to the Bose companions I had before. The Chroma effect was cool though, I wish they could have worked out.
customer_reviews.author: RoamingShopper

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, but quit working
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, crisp sound for a reasonable price. Updated: 6 months later speakers lost audio then 2 weeks later will not power on. Have started a warranty claim with Razer but no response after a week. Very disappointed in customer service right now. Have used Razer products since 1998, so far have not had to make a warranty claim on any product until now. Had expectations of good response times, so far no luck.
customer_reviews.author: jblake

customer_reviews.title: Decent speakers
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through many speakers and the main reason for going with this pair was because it DIDN'T have a separate subwoofer. I have soundbars and other speaker sets around the house, each with a subwoofer. From initial reviews I've read and seen, they said it had enough bass, and for my purposes it's very good. I wouldn't say they are the best sounding speakers in the world, BUT for the price it is definitely good and they look good as well!
customer_reviews.author: namkyu

customer_reviews.title: Nice volume and base but the brightness lighting?...
customer_reviews.text: Since I like razer a lot I will give this a 5 star but it could of been 4 because I have the brightness on max and the light is not so bright at all, but you can still see it not as much if your room is dark. The sound is amazing and the base is wonderful and believable it or not it saves space on your table because most speakers are like “long Rectangular shaped”. I love everything about it but exempt one thing... the brightness is kind of dim. So that may bother a few people but other then that these speakers is worth getting.
customer_reviews.author: Adan Vidal

customer_reviews.title: These Sound Great
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound quality. Very loud, I often can't keep the bass at max due to my own comfort during gaming. Love these, look great on my desk. My only qualm with this is that I wish there was more RGB for Razer chroma, such as around the speakerhead, but that was known before I bought the product and I will not fault it for it.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Eilers

customer_reviews.title: I like them but...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, i truly do think the speakers sound very very good. I got these because they were RGB and i wanted to set them to static green to match my setup. The lighting on them isn't very bright at all, which i was abit disappointed by. I even checked razer synapse and the brightness on them is at 100%. I was very disappointed by this at first, but once i heard how nice and crisp things sound, it didn't bother me nearly as much. I was just shocked at how dim the lighting was because of how much brighter my lighting is on my other razer products I'm currently using. Besides that, i love the way they sound!
customer_reviews.author: Reanna Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Way Bigger Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, these are huge. The sound is crisp and clear, the base knob versus the volume knob separation is wonderful, the colors are beautiful and work with Synapse 3, and after dealing with the sound quality from my built in speakers in my monitors, it is so nice to be able ot hear the sound from all around versus one monitor of two. Worth the cost and the amount of desk space they use up.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Connecting cable is too short. Can only use one speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Come on with these short cable lengths. I can’t connect the speakers because they’re too far apart. 10 feet minimum or include an extension cable for crying out loud.
customer_reviews.author: JoelDT

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality as you'd expect from Razer. I only took off 1 star because the chroma on the bottom isn't very bright. You almost need to put them on a white surface or a small coaster size mirror or something. They're not COMPLETELY dull, just strangely more dull than all the other razer accessories. Sound quality is top notch and the bass is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Justen McLain

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: The size of these speakers are convenient and their design is unique. But compared to 2-way speakers at a similar price point, they are more inferior in terms of bass response. I am a music producer with Klipsch monitors for my main drivers, but I wanted to try something different for my living room computer. Don’t get me wrong, they’re good. But there are better speakers out there. I’d only buy this if you’re on a tight budget with tight space. And BTW, I love RGB, but $50 extra dollars for that shiz is kind of a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Linh Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Run!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is exactly what I need for a small office. I do not need the crazy theater speakers for work and light gaming. These are perfect. Update: 22 August 2020. Do not buy. After a month, the sound quality rapidly decreased and the speakers randomly shut-off with a loud static screeching. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely not for gaming. Go with the bose for the same price.
customer_reviews.text: I cant recommends these. They are worth $50 new at the most. The volume has to be almost maxed out just to hear them at normal listening levels. They are ok for youtube but absolutely not gaming. For the $100 bucks that these cost I would look at the Bose instead. 2.5 out of 5 stars. Very average sounding speakers.
customer_reviews.author: aron sprague

customer_reviews.title: Great for music and gaming; not for a party.
customer_reviews.text: I play a ton of games and love to chill and jam out to music. Perfect for me: lots of bass for rock and metal, lower bass and loud for gaming. Beautiful. Cannon-like designs blast the sound at me perfectly. But if you plan to buy this for a party or larger scale speakers, I highly recommend looking at a different pair. The cannon designs do great for one person to aim sound at, but I can imagine what it would be like trying to use these for a larger room like a living or dining room, or for more than 5-10 people. Overall, amazing speakers. Don't use for parties.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ferrero

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a gamer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer. I just bought these because I've been stuck at my desk working from home for 6 months. I wanted to listen to music as I worked 10-11 hours a day. I listen to a lot of EDM, classic rock and these speakers sounds great w/ either genre. They are way cheaper on Amazon vs Razor website.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Big Razer Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I have Razer everything but I can tell you these speakers do not put out the sound quality. They are decent for what they are but I find myself using my headset more. Also the rob lights on the bottom, you can’t even really see (I messed with all the brightness settings). Additionally, they take up a lot of space on your desk, so if you want a clean set up look; these may not be for you. Overall: decent sound but not better than my hyperX headset. Cool RGB, but you don’t even notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Razer can't build hardware to save their life. Dead after a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: These are BIG - and sound great!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers were about 4x bigger than I expected when I ordered. I know that is my fault - could have paid better attention to the specs. However, that was a good surprise. These are capable speakers with really solid bass for the price. I got more than I expected. I have gone back and forth with Razer for a few years and chose these over a set of Logitech speakers for purely aesthetic reasons - and because I did not have room to place a subwoofer on the floor in my home office. I dont miss the subwoofer at all. My only gripe is I really do not like the Razer software. Other than that, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Posey

customer_reviews.title: if you're looking for loud speakers, or any bass, get the g560.
customer_reviews.text: No problem with the speakers, the quality seems good. But there just isn't enough power to them, at 100% volume, you can talk to someone across the room at a semi normal tone. The bass is lacking, which is to be expected with no sub woofer. Overall, they seem to be DECENT, but the price is a bit high for decent. I would say you'll be better off buying the G560, or the baseline Bose satellite speakers for $99.00.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Clear and Crisp
customer_reviews.text: I did not purchase the model with the led colored feature, I was after sound quality at a reasonable price and these speakers did/do the job extremely well. I would not say i'm an audiophile but I do appreciate good sound whether gaming, listening to music or watching a video. These speakers have not let me down.
customer_reviews.author: BadPennyKenny

customer_reviews.title: A tad pricey, but doesn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: I should start off by noting that although it isnt super clear in the instructions, you can hook this up to anything with a 3.5mm jack or up to a computer. 3.5mm input will of course not allow you control any of the lighting effects. This is definitely very, very nice set of speakers for anyone's set up if you have the money to splurge on nicer speakers, although being made by Razer that just comes with the territory. Clear audio, very deep, adjustable bass and they sound fantastic hooked up to anything.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: No bass software sucks
customer_reviews.text: Good speakers I went with Razer because I have a razer keyboard and mouse and headphones. But the speakers have no eq settings on Razer Synapses. Only 4 preset options that kinda suck. The music setting seems best. The bass is non existent. If you wanted bass you had to get the nommo pro which is like 600 I think I saw. But the sound is nice the feel is nice the rgb color is great. But the software sucks. And the bass sucks. For the price I could of got something way better but I wanted Razer. So I made my decision lol. I wish I didn’t and got something better.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Bradanick

customer_reviews.title: Yeah They Sound Nice
customer_reviews.text: Like The Title of this they do sound nice and look amazing so go a head and get them if you want they are equal to the one that lights up just minus the light and to be honest you don't need all that lighting on a desk or speakers but if you must to get style points on you're friends or youtubers then get them or get the $400 dollar ones to really set the town
customer_reviews.author: Insidious Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Sounds is ok but... LED effect very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great but when buying a 500$ product like this, i wish razer did a better job on the LED's. They are extremely disappointing. Very dim. Not because of the lights themselves, but because of the design. I think the base overhangs over the LED's a bit too much. doesn't appear anywhere as bright as the Razer Firefly for instance. Was considering maybe purchasing circular mirror plates for them to sit on and see if that helps at all.
customer_reviews.author: Grant J. Harkins

customer_reviews.title: Big sound
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Great for gaming and video. Watch out for base. Travels through walls. For no sub it does great job
customer_reviews.author: RG   #tryingtohelp

customer_reviews.title: 👌
customer_reviews.text: Overall pretty satisfied. I got them because I wanted more bass and was tired of that tinny rattling sound my other speakers had at higher frequencies. I don't have that problem with these speakers and I don't mind the lower volume capacity. But I do wish that the bass was better. For $100 you could do better but all in all I'm pretty satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are some of my favorite computer speakers to date, the chroma option is a nice touch as well with an unlimited options for color varieties. Overall the sound is great and has a nice immersion sound. The price is pretty fair if you take into consideration the sound quality and the chroma addition but overall I think it was a solid buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I need a set of speakers for my desktop but didn't need a whole stereo system. I went with these for the visual aspect. It look good on my desk and with my PC set-up. They sound good enough. Though I mostly use headphones when using the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: These things are huge! - Sounds not that great!
customer_reviews.text: The Razer speakers are huge - the photos on the site do not give it the right prospective. Now the sound is not as good as my Bose Companion speakers. I was hoping for a richer sound experience and also something to match up with the rest of the Razer products I have.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bittan

customer_reviews.title: Needs a remote
customer_reviews.text: Update: For $500 they should have a remote. I would like to buy a set for my TV, but with only a nob to control the sound I can not justify another $500 and have to get up to change the sound. Also, customer service is not in America and are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: bryan taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy and High Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are perfect for my setup and sound great. Audio through the headphone jack is clear. They are capable of solid base especially when used on a desktop. Cables are high quality. If there is a negative the lights are dimmer than expected. Overall, I like.
customer_reviews.author: votehart

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas Idea 👍😁
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas for my sister. She absolutely loves these. I highly recommend these speakers. Also, it's very colorful lights make it very astonishing. Gaming, music, or whatever the needs are, you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Jerding

customer_reviews.title: Cannons
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are great for the price. RGB is a nice aesthetic but obviously doesn't affect the quality of sound, so you could totally get away with the regular nommo speakers to save a few bucks (but who doesn't want RGB these days). My only gripe is the size of the speakers. The horizontal form factor of the top of the speaker was a little troublesome to position comfortably and I had to rearrange my dual monitor mount a little to accommodate them (luckily, I have a decent sized desk). The sound is great, bass boost is great; these speakers really kick.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary P.

customer_reviews.title: Nommo Pro Costs too much?
customer_reviews.text: Yes these are a little over priced, they do come with a Razer tax. I did upgrade from the Razer soundbar (which is also great) for no reason other then boredom. I'm sure you can find studio speakers that are just as good, but you buy these and pay a little more because you know it's a great set. I'd buy again, rate these a 5/5 for the niche gamer who wants a solid 9/10 gaming speaker. Only con's are no remote and RBG lighting is so minimal for a razer product (odd for their high end speaker system), I think my mouse gives off more light.
customer_reviews.author: Random Brian

customer_reviews.title: 2 Months, stopped turning on.
customer_reviews.text: The good'ole "It was nice when it worked" review. 2 Months, purchased on 4/3/2019... worth of very light use. I work rotating 12s so I don't get much time to use them, sounded and looked great. Today, 6/5/2019 they no longer turn on. They are now being sent back via RMA. This thing is not light and easy to toss in a box, extremely inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: christina frklic

customer_reviews.title: Will not power on after not even a full year of minimal use
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sounded great when they worked but after only 10 months of minimal usage they won't power on. I am so disappointed with Razer. When speakers that cost this much don't even last a full year at no ones fault but the manufacturer it is 100% UNACCEPTABLE. I've seen multiple people talk about this issue in the comments and question sections of this item. I wish I saw them before I purchased this $600 bundle of garbage. And for some reason their factory warranty doesn't even cover 1 year... You burned me once Razer, never again.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 34 days
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound AMAZING. Unfortunately, they died for absolutely no reason after 34 days of light use on my home office PC. Amazon was kind enough to offer an exchange, but I would skip these speakers for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kalbranai

customer_reviews.title: Best Office Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Beat 99 dollar product I have ever made. These are incredible! I do not use them for gaming. I wanted speakers that produced directional sound vs room filling. Because I work in an office with several others. I love how at low volume that bass is present without anybody complaining.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but they sound incredible!
customer_reviews.text: These sound amazing. They look awesome. I would've preferred them to be a little less pricey, and there's some crackling using the audio input instead of the USB, but overall I'm more than happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: friendlyyan

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: These sound great and fit in well with all of my other Chroma items. Only complaint is that they are maybe a little overpriced. I still like them and they look good with the rest of my setup
customer_reviews.author: Troy Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: and as an added bonus they sound great to my laymen ears and have punchy base
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that I am not a major audiophile by any means and though quality sound was a concern of mine when deciding upon what speakers to get for my setup, aesthetics was probably the major factor which drove my purchase of these speakers. They compliment my matte black clean minimalist look very well, and as an added bonus they sound great to my laymen ears and have punchy base. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer C

customer_reviews.title: An equalizer is a must!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I don't need to tell anyone who is reading this that. BUT. If you use an equalizer (free software pc) It changes the game completely. it takes these things from being average/above average to fantastic. dead serious.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: A little bigger than I thought they would be, but the sounds quality is excellent. Bass doesn’t hit that hard, but they are only 3” and I didn’t buy it for that. So perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Billy White

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the product
customer_reviews.text: The speakers didnt work. I downloaded everything, followed directions and they wouldn't work. I returned them and went with a different brand. Very disappointed as all my other Razor Nommo Chromo items work great. May be just a faulty set, or something with the way I installed them, either way, you cant really judge and review something you didnt get to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Got the product after it being 7 days late. Hooked everything up....nothing. These things are junk. There is 0 quality control going on at this company. Returning them just as fast as i unboxed them and will not purchase these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Lunar

customer_reviews.title: good speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than you may think. The bass is great, but thats it. Do not think this can be a versatile speaker for both music and gaming. After all, it is a gaming speaker, produced by the leading gaming equipment company. If you like Jazz and Bossanova, great. if you like classic, so so. Remember, the product is bigger than it looks like the cylindar part of the speaker is as big as a clorox box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy, Pretty much plug and play. Sound quality is excellent and have had no issues since purchase in December 2018. I have read in other reports that the tweeter cones were pressed in upon arrival, my set fortunately was not damaged at all. The subwoofer is impressive. The chroma lights are slick and well placed, its not over pronounced and complements the overall design well. After seeing some of the negative reviews i was indeed hesitant, but i am completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are a little bigger than I expected, but the sound quality is amazing! Even for gaming, if you're not going to use a headset, these speakers are great for immersing you in the directional sounds from the game.
customer_reviews.author: Michele H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid speakers worth price
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers, solid sound quality, bass and volume. Buttons feel good when used. Work well with other razer products as advertised of course. Complaints that lights are too dim are somewhat valid, they are a bit dimmer than my other razer products. I still think they look great, especially at night. Worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: Erik Morlock

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality but one thing I don't like.
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it a 5 but whenever I'd like to for example play on my playstation. I some times like to unplug them from my PC and into my ps4 but they don't work on ps4. Other than that everything works perfectly fine!
customer_reviews.author: David Bejerano

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, unique and sharp look.
customer_reviews.text: These have great sound (including more than enough high quality bass). They also look great on my desk. Only downside is that razer customization software (synapse 3.0) not available yet for my Mac. Not a deal breaker as the audio doesn’t need calibration or customization. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The overall package is really nice for the Razer Ecosystem, I love everything about them really. My only complaint really is that the bass isn’t too full but it is loud and punchy. It doesn’t reach crazy low frequencies which is to be expected, but they still bump
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this prime day purchase. Very high quality and RGB looks fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are great speakers. Sound quality is very good, and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: Best speakers I've bought
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of searching purchasing several different speakers and these ones are by far the best sub $150 speakers in my opinion. Very good sound quality plus I don't get any random audio pops like literally all other speakers have done. My only issue is the ones with extra base are like $250 which is no longer worth it. If you're gonna spend $250 might as well get some Sennheiser
customer_reviews.author: Donovan A

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.text: First of all these are a pair of 2.0 speakers. This means no subwoofer at all. With that being said these are amazing speakers. Vocals sound great with a good amount of bass. They get really loud too. Note(these speakers are not only meant for gaming they are also for music and movies). The rgb is good but somewhat dim compared to other Razer products. They are a really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: kingm561

customer_reviews.title: This versus the Leviathan- NO COMPARISON!
customer_reviews.text: The Leviathan does not even remotely close stand up as a competitor of these speakers. I got the Nommo Pro, it sounds fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: rifth

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Well package. Nice quality feel to them. Set up took minutes including the software. Much louder than I thought with great bass
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers For Music And Gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality Desktop Speakers. Built Very Well And Get Very Loud In Your Room, I Think It Needs More Bass But Still Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Osburn

customer_reviews.title: Really nice lights. That's about it.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to add these to my gaming set up. After setting them up I was disappointed in the sound quality, so I decided to use a splitter for my old audio system and this one to combine the audio qualities. After messing around with the audio for a while, I had finally got the sound where I wanted it. Shortly after I had noticed I had completely turned the Razer speakers off and was just hearing the old ones. I returned them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: BSIncorporated

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I like the interesting design that Razer went for with their features, unlike normal boring shelf speakers. The only problem with these is the sound, since you have to switch settings for gaming, music, movie, and default. Besides that, great speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine McKee

customer_reviews.title: Huge but awesome
customer_reviews.text: Pro awesome speakers with chrome, cons Flipping huge like seriously it's a small bazooka tube; had to return because it just didnt work for my space.
customer_reviews.author: TheCihaks

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Sounds outstanding! Loudest set of speakers I've ever owned, and super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Shorty hoffman

customer_reviews.title: All style, But sounds like mud
customer_reviews.text: They have the styling you expect from Razer, but they just sound empty and distant. Thats when they worked for me. The right speaker would sometimes just get super quiet or just seem to die. not worth it at the price. A soundbar at the same price works and sounds much better.
customer_reviews.author: FlashFlood

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Just Receive these today and I'm in Love. Paired these with my Turtle Beach Elite 2 Pro Amp on Ps4 Pro and Sounds Amazing. Must Buy
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Diaz

customer_reviews.title: TTV/nerdynergy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely in love. I'm making the switch to Razer just bc of my amazing experience with these speakers. I love how interactive the lights are to games.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers, meh RGB
customer_reviews.text: Just like most razer products, it’s really good build quality and has very nice sound. However I would avoid the chroma version unless you absolutely have to have rbg. The brightness/visibility of the rgb is not worth the price difference in my opinion. If you have a firefly mousepad, it’s about the same brightness as that, but since they’re usually pushed further back on the desk it looks even less bright. Sound quality is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: Amazing set of speakers and sound quality is exceptional, defiantly recommended for those that want to keep a simplicity look yet a banging system. Only thing I can gripe about is the speaker cables to the sub is too short for me.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Speaker quality is great, the rgb lighting is pretty poor though which is a bit of a bummer since you pay an extra $50 for it basically. Overall the speakers sound good and look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Komma

customer_reviews.title: Good for desktop gaming.
customer_reviews.text: When am not using headphones I use these for casual gaming. They work great. Loud enough for desktop gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Acuknome

customer_reviews.title: Big Sound From A Small Enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Was very surprised when I hooked these up and started playing some music, wow! Haven't tried it for anything else as of yet but that was primarily the purpose was to listen to music
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Sound and look great!
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers they sound amazing and look awesome! I wish they were a little cheaper to be honest but they were worth it! Great to complete my razer peripherals setup!
customer_reviews.author: David Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love them. And they’re loud. The sound is fantastic. Incredibly clear. My husband loves them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound and look awesome
customer_reviews.text: These sound and look brilliant. They are slightly taller than I was expecting, they're not tiny by any stretch. Sound is fantastic for a two speaker setup. The RGB is subtle but well executed. Build quality is fantastic, all the way down to the cables.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Lane

customer_reviews.title: Good sound.  Didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds pretty good. The lighting effect is nice as well. Purchased in July, died 3 and 1/2 months later. No power. Dead to the world :(
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W.

product_meta.title: Razer Nommo Chroma: Custom Woven 3" Glass Fiber Drivers - Rear-Facing Bass Ports - Bass Knob w/ Automatic Gain Control - Razer Chroma Enabled - Full Range 2.0 PC Gaming Speakers, Black
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:Single| Style:Nommo ChromaThe Razer Nommo Chroma is designed for gamers who want to flood their rooms with the sounds of their favorite games, music and movies. With custom woven glass fiber 3-inch drivers, a wide sound field with high positional accuracy, dedicated rear-facing firing bass ports, bass control with automatic gain control technology, and Razer Chroma lighting, you have the ultimate in power and versatility. Frequency response - 50-20,000hz
feature_bullets: FULL RANGE 2.0 GAMING SPEAKERS: Optimized drivers built for full range sound and extreme clarity
CUSTOM 3 inches WOVEN GLASS FIBER DRIVERS: Producting a tighter sound with higher frequencies, allowing you to hear disinct layers and audio details
REAR FACING BASS PORTS: Deliver increased bass output for a fuller, richer range of audio
BASS KNOB WITH AUTOMATIC GAIN CONTROL: Fine tune the output perfectly from ground shaking bass to a low hum for late night sessions
SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: PC/Mac with a free USB port, Razer Synapse requirements: Windows7/Mac OS X 10.9 (or higher), internet connection: 100 MB of free hard disk space
Note: Product comes with US plug type

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars876 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
